text:
Hi Team,
We are facing RATE LIMIT error in the access token
generation API in our HubSpot application. Curl request and error are
mentioned below. correlationId and requestId not showing in the error
response.
If anyone knows how we can fix this kindly let us know.

Curl Request:
curl --location --request POST '<https://api.hubapi.com/oauth/v1/token>' \
--header 'Accept: /' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded;charset=utf-8' \
--data-raw 'grant_type=refresh_token&client_id=xxxxxxxxxxxxxx&client_secret=yyyyyyyyyy&refresh_token=zzzzzzzzzzz'

Curl Response:
Array
(
    [status] => error
    [message] => You have reached your rate limit.
    [errorType] => RATE_LIMIT
    [correlationId] =>
    [policyName] => SECONDLY
    [requestId] =>
)

Thanks in advance !!
<@U02DH5CK90T> I am going to make this repository. So if you can fork it, that would be great. Thank you!
Hi <@U038UGMHLLQ> Ah sorry I did not yet Fork it. Would it be possible to make it viewable so that I can save it?

Hello:  I have a PHP App on a server that monitors some data and it needs to send this data to HubSpot.  It needs to use Oauth2.  How do I get a token/refresh token programmatically without user interface of HubSpot asking me to log in?
Use api key if you don't need to use auth2

I'm trying to use the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/email|email engagements API> to create some emails (at <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/emails/>) and attach them to a ticket. However, if I try to include the `hs_email_sender_x` or `hs_email_to_x` properties (such as `hs_email_sender_firstname`) the API complains that those are read-only and won't create the email. I can only create it when I omit those properties, but then when you look at the ticket in HubSpot there's no sender or recipient details, which isn't really great. Is there any way around this, or am I going to have to rethink this? Am I doing something wrong?
Hey <@U3A4KEWK1> can you submit a support ticket for this one?
I can, though I've discovered that the v1 API seems to work for my needs better.
oh yeah?  may i ask why?
Well, I _can_ set the sender name and email and stuff in the v1 API
v3 is certainly nicer to use, except for this sender data thing
Oh, so if that wasn't an issue, V1 is no better?
No, v1 lets me add sender metadata that shows up in the HubSpot dashboard, but v3 doesn't.
v3 seems better in most respects, it just won't let me create a message with hs_email_sender_firstname and stuff defined.
